channel.title: News from World
channel.description: Latest news updates from HindustanTimes.com for WorldSectionPage-Topstories. For more updates hop on to HindustanTimes.com.

channel.itunes:subtitle: Latest news updates from HindustanTimes.com for WorldSectionPage-Topstories. For more updates hop on to HindustanTimes.com.

item.title: US-academic-attacked-gangraped-in-Papua-New-Guinea
item.description: A US academic has been gangraped by an armed mob in Papua New Guinea, barely a week after an Australian was killed and his friend sexually assaulted by a group of men.

item.title: We-have-1-tn-infrastructure-deficit-FM-to-World-Bank
item.description: India has a $1 trillion infrastructure deficit over the next five years, finance minister P Chidambaram has told the World Bank, which wants private sector participation to bridge the funding gap.

item.title: How-5-day-manhunt-for-US-bomb-suspects-unfolded
item.description: It began on Monday with two bombs, about 10 seconds apart, just shy of the finish line of the Boston Marathon, blasts that sounded the start of a new race - to identify and find those responsible. This is how that race unfolded.

item.title: Bombers-path-to-Boston-may-have-begun-online
item.description: The two brothers suspected of the Boston bombings, Chechens who grew up in America, fit the profile of a new generation of jihadists who are radicalized online and strike in their home countries.
item.itunes:subtitle: The two brothers suspected of the Boston bombings, Chechens who grew up in America, fit the profile of a new generation of jihadists who are radicalized online and strike in their home countries.
item.itunes:summary: The two brothers suspected of the Boston bombings, Chechens who grew up in America, fit the profile of a new generation of jihadists who are radicalized online and strike in their home countries.

item.title: Sex-sabotage-and-videotape-in-Malaysian-campaign
item.description: Malaysia's ruling establishment has been accused of resorting to "gutter politics" as a bruising election campaign starts amid outrage over sex videos and opposition charges of sabotage.
item.itunes:subtitle: Malaysia's ruling establishment has been accused of resorting to "gutter politics" as a bruising election campaign starts amid outrage over sex videos and opposition charges of sabotage.
item.itunes:summary: Malaysia's ruling establishment has been accused of resorting to "gutter politics" as a bruising election campaign starts amid outrage over sex videos and opposition charges of sabotage.

item.title: 6-1-quake-hits-Japan-s-coast-no-tsunami-warning
item.description: A 6.1-magnitude earthquake struck off the south coast of Japan's main Honshu island on Sunday, the United States Geological Survey said, but no tsunami warning was issued.

item.title: Denver-Shots-fired-at-US-pot-holiday-gathering-2-injured
item.description: Gunfire erupted at an annual US marijuana celebration, injuring two people and scattering a crowd of thousands after they had just marked the first 4/20 counterculture holiday since Colorado legalized marijuana.

item.title: Chechen-is-not-the-same-as-Czech-Czech-government-reminds
item.description: Chechen is not the same as Czech. The Czech Republic is different from Chechnya. That is the simple message that the Czech government wants Americans to know.

item.title: North-Korea-moves-two-more-missile-launchers
item.description: North Korea has moved two short-range missile launchers to its east coast, apparently indicating it is pushing ahead with preparations for a test launch, a South Korean news agency reported on Sunday.

item.title: Syria-opposition-urges-surgical-strikes-on-Assad-missiles
item.description: Syria's opposition on Saturday called on international supporters to carry out "surgical strikes" on positions used by President Bashar al-Assad's regime to fire missiles on civilians.

item.title: Boston-bombings-Uncle-says-older-suspect-used-brother
item.description: Whatever drove the two brothers to allegedly set off two deadly pressure-cooker bombs in Boston Marathon, their uncle is certain that the younger brother Dzhokhar was not the one pulling the strings.

item.title: France-s-Hollande-sinks-to-new-popularity-low
item.description: French President Francois Hollande's popularity rating slumped six points in a month to hit 25%, worse than his predecessor Nicolas Sarkozy's lowest ever score, a survey said.

item.title: Iraq-counts-votes-from-first-polls-since-US-pullout
item.description: Iraqi election officials were to begin counting votes on Sunday from the country's first elections since US troops departed, which served as a key test of its stability amid a spike in violence.

item.title: UN-calls-for-end-to-Central-African-Republic-violence
item.description: The United Nations has urged Central African Republic Prime Minister Nicolas Tiangaye to restore security in the strife-torn nation, a UN spokesman said on Saturday.

item.title: Maduro-victory-will-stand-despite-audit-Venezuelan-election-official
item.description: An audit of election returns cannot overturn Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduros's win, a top election official said Saturday, warning the opposition against creating "false expectations."

item.title: Boston-Marathon-bombing-investigation-turns-to-motive
item.description: The surviving suspect in the Boston Marathon bombings lay seriously wounded and unable to speak in a hospital on Saturday as investigators worked to determine a motive and whether the two ethnic Chechen brothers accused of the attack acted alone.

item.title: Huge-rescue-effort-as-China-quake-toll-reaches-179
item.description: Thousands of rescue workers combed through quake-shattered villages in southwest China on Sunday in a race to find survivors as the death toll from a powerful tremor the day before rose to 179.

item.title: Boston-bombings-suspect-unable-to-speak
item.description: The 19-year-old is "serious but stable," Massachusetts governor Deval Patrick told reporters Saturday. "I think not able to communicate yet."
item.itunes:subtitle: The 19-year-old is "serious but stable," Massachusetts governor Deval Patrick told reporters Saturday. "I think not able to communicate yet."
item.itunes:summary: The 19-year-old is "serious but stable," Massachusetts governor Deval Patrick told reporters Saturday. "I think not able to communicate yet."

item.title: Boston-bomb-suspect-hospitalised-under-heavy-guard
item.description: The surviving suspect in the Boston Marathon bombing lay hospitalized under heavy guard Saturday as people across the area breathed easier and investigators tried to piece together the motive for the deadly plot.

item.title: Boston-bomb-suspect-drove-over-brother-police
item.description: Boston bombing suspect Dzhokhar Tsarnaev drove over his dying brother to escape a gunbattle with police, the police chief of the town where the manhunt ended said Saturday.

item.title: Will-not-give-up-nuclear-arms-N-Korea
item.description: North Korea reiterated on Saturday that it would not give up its nuclear weapons, rejecting a US condition for talks although it said it was willing to discuss disarmament.

item.title: Verdict-Savita-died-of-medical-misadventure
item.description: The husband of Savita Halappanavar, the Indian dentist who died of miscarriage after being denied treatment in an Irish hospital, said he plans to take the case to the European Court of Human Rights after an inquest returned a verdict of "medical misadventure." Dipankar De Sarkar reports.

item.title: The-Brothers-Tsarnaev
item.description: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, 19, the younger brother, was a US citizen, read the oath of allegiance on Sept 11, 2012, on the anniversary of a day that changed the US. Yashwant Raj reports. The Chechens and the Boston bombings
item.itunes:subtitle: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, 19, the younger brother, was a US citizen, read the oath of allegiance on Sept 11, 2012, on the anniversary of a day that changed the US. Yashwant Raj reports. The Chechens and the Boston bombings
item.itunes:summary: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, 19, the younger brother, was a US citizen, read the oath of allegiance on Sept 11, 2012, on the anniversary of a day that changed the US. Yashwant Raj reports. The Chechens and the Boston bombings

item.title: Boston-celebrates-as-second-bomber-caught
item.description: As the manhunt for the second Boston bombing suspect, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, finally ended Friday evening, relieved residents lined the streets to cheer departing law enforcement officials. Yashwant Raj reports.

item.title: Taliban-amputate-two-Afghans-as-punishment-police
item.description: Afghanistan's Taliban Islamic insurgents have amputated a hand and a foot of two private security guards because they worked for foreign troops, police and one of the victims said today.
